summary: Cuttlefish are ocean animals related to squids and octopuses. They have a special bone inside their bodies that helps them float. Cuttlefish have big eyes, eight arms, and two long tentacles with sticky suckers to catch prey like crabs and fish. They grow up to 20 inches long and weigh over 20 pounds. Dolphins, sharks, and seabirds hunt cuttlefish, which live for about 1-2 years. Cuttlefish are very smart for invertebrates and have large brains for their size. In ancient Greece and Rome, people used the brown ink cuttlefish release when scared for art and writing.
title: Cuttlefish
